skills.name: Sort and class quadrilaterals into hierarchical families

explanations.A: Every square has four equal sides, so every square is a rhombus, but do squares have the properties of any other shape here?
explanations.B: Every square has four right angles and two pairs of parallel sides, so every square is a rectangle, but do squares have the properties of any other shape here?
explanations.C: Every square has two pairs of parallel sides so every square is a parallelogram, but do squares have the properties of any other shape here?
explanations.D: Every square has four equal sides so it's a rhombus, four right angles so it's a rectangle, and two pairs of parallel sides so it's a parallelogram. A square is a special case of all three of these shapes!

explanations.A: A rhombus is any quadrilateral with all equal sides. Do all rectangles have equal sides? Think about the properties of a rectangle (has 4 sides: 2 pairs of parallel sides, 4 right angles) and compare these with each possible answer.
explanations.B: A quadrilateral is any shape with four sides. Every rectangle has 4 sides so every rectangle is a quadrilateral.
explanations.C: Every square has 4 sides of equal length. Do all rectangles have 4 sides of equal lengths? Think about the properties of a rectangle (has 4 sides: 2 pairs of parallel sides, 4 right angles) and compare these with each possible answer.
explanations.D: A rectangle has two pairs of parallel sides, and a trapezoid only has one. Can we ever have a square with only one pair of parallel sides? Think about the properties of a rectangle (has 4 sides: 2 pairs of parallel sides, 4 right angles) and compare these with each possible answer.

explanations.A: A trapezoid only has one pair of parallel sides so it can't be a rhombus. Which of these can have just one pair of parallel sides?
explanations.B: A trapezoid only has one pair of parallel sides so it can't be a rectangle. Which of these can have just one pair of parallel sides?
explanations.C: A trapezoid only has one pair of parallel sides so it can't be a parallelogram. Which of these can have just one pair of parallel sides?
explanations.D: Every trapezoid has four sides so it is a quadrilateral. Every other shape here has two pairs of parallel sides, and a trapezoid only has one.

explanations.A: A rhombus is any quadrilateral with all equal sides. Do all parallelograms have equal sides? Think about the properties of a parallelogram (has 4 sides: 2 pairs of parallel sides) and compare these with each possible answer.
explanations.B: Parallelograms and rectangles both have two pairs of parallel sides but rectangles also have 4 right-angles. Do all parallelograms have 4 right-angles? Think about the properties of a parallelogram (has 4 sides: 2 pairs of parallel sides) and compare these with each possible answer.
explanations.C: A parallelogram has two pairs of parallel sides but a trapezoid only has one pair of parallel sides, so can a shape ever be both? Think about the properties of a parallelogram (has 4 sides: 2 pairs of parallel sides) and compare these with each possible answer.
explanations.D: A quadrilateral is any shape with four sides. Every parallelogram has 4 sides so every parallelogram is a quadrilateral.

explanations.A: A trapezoid has only one pair of parallel sides. Is that true for every single quadrilateral?
explanations.B: A trapezoid has four sides, so it is a type of quadrilateral. That means sometimes a quadrilateral is a trapezoid, but only when it has a single pair of parallel sides.
explanations.C: A trapezoid has four sides, so a quadrilateral can be a trapezoid. Is it always a trapezoid?
explanations.D: A quadrilateral is any shape with four sides, but a trapezoid must have one pair of parallel sides, so they are not the same. Can a quadrilateral ever be a trapezoid?

explanations.A: All rhombuses have two pairs of parallel sides, so all rhombuses are parallelograms - they are a special case that also has 4 equal sides.
explanations.B: A parallelogram is any quadrilateral with two pairs of parallel sides. What does that tell us about any rhombus?
explanations.C: Both a rhombus and a parallelogram have two pairs of parallel sides, but a rhombus must have four equal sides. These facts can help with finding the correct answer.
explanations.D: Both a rhombus and a parallelogram have two pairs of parallel sides, but a rhombus must have four equal sides. These facts can help with finding the correct answer.

explanations.A: A trapezoid has only one pair of parallel sides. Can we ever have a square with only one pair of parallel sides?
explanations.B: A trapezoid has only one pair of parallel sides. Can we ever have a square with only one pair of parallel sides?
explanations.C: A square has two pairs of a parallel sides and a trapezoid has only one, so a square cannot be a trapezoid.
explanations.D: A square has two pairs of a parallel sides and a trapezoid has only one, so they are not the same. Can a square ever be a trapezoid?

explanations.A: A quadrilateral is any shape with four sides. All squares have 4 sides so squares are always quadrilaterals.
explanations.B: A quadrilateral is any shape with four sides. How many sides must a square have?
explanations.C: A quadrilateral is any shape with four sides. How many sides must a square have?
explanations.D: A quadrilateral is any shape with four sides. And a square is one possible kind of quadrilateral, one with 4 equal sides and 4 right-angles. So they cannot be classified as being the same.

explanations.A: A rhombus has two pairs of parallel sides, and a trapezoid only has one. Can we ever have a trapezoid with two pairs of parallel sides?
explanations.B: A rhombus has two pairs of parallel sides, and a trapezoid only has one. Can we ever have a trapezoid with two pairs of parallel sides?
explanations.C: A rhombus has two pairs of parallel sides, and a trapezoid only has one. So a trapezoid can never be a rhombus.
explanations.D: A rhombus has two pairs of parallel sides, and a trapezoid only has one. Can we ever have a trapezoid with two pairs of parallel sides?

explanations.A: A parallelogram is any quadrilateral with two pairs of parallel sides. Therefore every square is a parallelogram.
explanations.B: A parallelogram is any quadrilateral with two pairs of parallel sides. Do squares ever have this property?
explanations.C: A parallelogram is any quadrilateral with two pairs of parallel sides. Do squares ever have this property?
explanations.D: A parallelogram is any quadrilateral with two pairs of parallel sides. A square also has this property but, a square also has 4 equal sides and 4 right-angles. So, a square is not the same as a parallelogram. How often do squares match the definition of a parallelogram?
